item.title: Atomfall: How To Fix Sound/Audio Not Working
item.description:
The world of Atomfall is set in a post-apocalyptic British countryside, where you have to survive using any means you can. Players will have to face various creatures and characters during their playthrough, and not all of them will be kind. Sadly, the game has been subject to quite a lot of bugs on release, and fixing certain ones can prove to be especially tricky.

Many players report that, after launching the game, they either have no sound at all, or it works but comes with errors. This, of course, can completely ruin a player's experience. Fortunately, there are several ways for players to fix this issue, but for those unsure about where to begin, here's how to fix the sound not working error in Atomfall .

What Is Causing The Audio Error In Atomfall?

Before you take any action, you should find out what is causing the error in Atomfall . Most likely, the reason lies in the game code; this is the issue for a lot of players. As such, we expect that the developers will be able to fix this annoying error with the next patch. However, waiting for the developers to act is not the only way to fix the sound not working error in Atomfall .

How To Fix The Sound Not Working Error In Atomfall

The easiest and fastest way to fix the Sound not Working Error in Atomfall is to relaunch the game. Since the cause of the error is down to the incorrect process of some game files, a good old relaunch can help to fix it.

It is worth noting that this method has helped quite a large number of players, but it didn't work for everyone.

If you are unlucky, and the audio still does not work, then you should check the integrity of the files . Fortunately, this is quite easy to do through the Steam menu:

  • Just find Atomfall in your library.
  • Then, right-click on it and select properties.
  • After that, go to the Local Files tab.
  • Here, click Verify Integrity of game files.

In addition, we recommend that you check your audio drivers . It often happens that outdated drivers can prevent many programs from working correctly, including Atomfall . You can easily do this through the Windows Update menu, where you can check all available drivers for your device.

The last but probably the most effective way to deal with the audio issue is to wait for patches and updates from the developers. Thanks to the reports of many players, Rebellion is probably aware of the sound not working error and is already working on its solution.

item.title: Street Fighter 6's Ace Attorney Collaboration is Only a Half Measure
item.description:
Even though Capcom hasn't released a new installment in the Ace Attorney series since 2017, it still keeps the franchise alive in a variety of different ways. Throughout the last several years, for instance, Capcom ported almost every game in the series to modern platforms. Additionally, in March 2025, the publisher hosted an Ace Attorney -themed crossover event for its hit 2023 fighting game, Street Fighter 6 . The event featured a Turnabout Gala battle pass, which contained unique rewards that were only accessible to players from March 3 to March 24.

Street Fighter 6 's Ace Attorney collaboration included a new Capcom arcade game, a set of Steel Samurai avatar gear, an Objection! emote, and a selection of music tracks taken directly from the Ace Attorney series. The battle pass for the event even featured some Ace Attorney -themed stickers and camera frames that players could use in the game's photo mode. As with all battle passes, however, the majority of these crossover items couldn't be obtained for free; instead, gamers had to purchase some of Street Fighter 6 's in-game currency to unlock them. Although it's nice that Capcom paid homage to the Ace Attorney franchise in Street Fighter 6 , this collaboration had one major issue: a lack of new guest characters.

Street Fighter 6's Ace Attorney Collab Could Have Been So Much More

Despite Collaborating With Several Franchises, SF6 Doesn't Have Many Guest Characters

Many of the Street Fighter games have received special characters from other franchises throughout the years, either through DLCs or enhanced re-releases. Street Fighter 6 , however, has been kept a bit more limited compared to its predecessors in this regard. To date, only two guest characters have appeared in the entire game: Terry Bogard and Mai Shiranui. Both of these fighters are from SNK's Fatal Fury and King of Fighters franchises, and they were included in the second season of DLC for Street Fighter 6 .

Much to the disappointment of fans, most of the collaborations in Street Fighter 6 have been lacking in depth. Capcom has held crossover events with other non-fighting game franchises in SF6 , including Spy x Family and even Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles , but they have only featured unlockable cosmetics so far. A lot of gamers likely expected these collaborations to add new fighters to the game, each with their own distinct abilities and movesets. Instead, they got nothing but glorified skins that cost a ridiculously high amount of real-world money and had no practical use gameplay-wise.

Capcom Should Have Made Phoenix Wright a Playable Character in SF6, Just as it Did in Ultimate MvC3

The fact that the recent Ace Attorney collaboration also suffered from this same problem is especially disappointing, considering how long fans have waited for the franchise's characters to appear in a fighting game again. Phoenix Wright, the main protagonist of the Ace Attorney series, did show up in a game similar to Street Fighter 6 in the past. In 2011, Capcom added him as a playable character in Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 , the enhanced re-release of the original MvC 3 . Despite being a lawyer with no superhuman abilities, Phoenix was actually a viable fighter to play as. He didn't feel like a last-minute addition to the game that was simply thrown in for laughs.

Capcom had the perfect opportunity to make up for the lack of new guest characters in Street Fighter 6 's crossover events by adding Phoenix Wright to the game, just as it did in Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 . Unfortunately, though, instead of doing this, the company opted to include a handful of Ace Attorney -themed stickers, photo frames, and armor sets for the recent collaboration. New cosmetic items can be exciting, but when a game like Street Fighter 6 pads out a crossover event by relying exclusively on them, they often end up being more disappointing than enjoyable.

item.title: Neil Druckmann Describes The Last of Us Season 2 as a ‘Wild Season’
item.description:
The Last of Us Season 2 is set to launch later this month, and it arrives off the back of a highly successful first season. Video game adaptations have been extremely hit-and-miss over the years, but HBO's show retains the core elements of what made the games so popular while building on the world and lore in new and interesting ways. Given that the second game's narrative proved hugely controversial, fans are keen to see exactly how Season 2 of the show will adapt the story.

Game Rant recently attended a press conference with The Last of Us Season 2 's cast and crew to discuss the new season. Neil Druckmann expressed his excitement about the show's return and the work that went into it. Returning for Season 2, Gabriel Pena, who plays Joel's brother Tommy, talked about how the show's new faces introduced a completely different dynamic.

The Last of Us Season 2 is Primed For Success

The impressive reception for The Last of Us ' first season probably caught a few people off guard. The flip side is that this positivity has cranked up the pressure for Season 2, particularly when The Last of Us Part 2 's narrative isn't anywhere near as universally loved as the first. Just how much Neil Druckmann and Craig Mazin decide to tweak this narrative for the show remains to be seen, but given how the first season closely mirrored the core events of the first game, fans aren't expecting wholesale changes. With Season 2's premiere within touching distance, Druckmann expressed his excitement. He said,

''It feels like now it's close enough where we can start visualizing and thinking about people watching this show, engaging with it, talking about it. We just have such an incredible cast and crew that have put absolutely everything on the line: incredible performances, sets, prosthetics, and VFX. We’ve got a wild season in front of you.''

Gabriel Pena on Returning as Tommy

Gabriel Pena is back as Joel's battle-hardened brother Tommy, and with Season 2 picking up five years after Season 1's finale, he is in a very different place mentally and physically than the last time viewers saw him. His relationship with his brother Joel is an important component of the story. Additionally, Pena explained how the plethora of new faces joining the cast brought new excitement and energy. The likes of Kaitlyn Dever, Young Mazino and Isabela Merced each brought something fresh to the table. Pena explained,

''It's good to be back. It's great to just get the family back together. But also, these new additions to the cast have strengthened the story in so many new and exciting ways. They’ve each brought a great love for the source material right into it with them. There's a beautiful infusion of youth and excitement and energy that they all brought. So, we're really excited for everyone to experience what we made.''

This blend of youth and experience could prove to be one of the key components of Season 2's success. The Last of Us Season 2 must delicately balance numerous storylines and characters, particularly considering there are only seven episodes. Striking the right balance between these characters and their relationships will ensure the show's pacing doesn't leave viewers with whiplash.

item.title: All Active Infinity Nikki Redeem Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Infinity Nikki Redeem Codes (April 2025)
  • Expired Infinity Nikki Codes
  • How To Redeem Infinity Nikki Codes

Infinity Nikki is a treat for fans of the Nikki dress-up game, as players can do more than dressing up Nikki with beautiful clothes. A special outfit pulls Nikki and Momo into Miraland, and there, the duo must understand why they got transported into the mysterious land. Players can explore the beautiful Miraland and have fun doing activities such as platforming, removing corruptions on the land, brushing animals, catching bugs, fishing, and so on.

Of course, dressing up remains the primary mechanic in the game, and the best way to get more outfits in Infinity Nikki is by drawing on the Resonance page. This part is a typical gacha process where players can get random pieces of an outfit and slowly build an entire set. To Resonate and get clothing items, Stylists must own the correct currency, like Diamonds and Crystals. These items can be obtained by playing the game, but at times, players can also redeem Infinity Nikki codes to get the items instantly.

Infinity Nikki Redeem Codes (April 2025)

Players can redeem the following Infinity Nikki codes to get rewards such as Diamonds or other resources:

Infinity Nikki codes are case-sensitive , so input them as they are. Additionally, some codes expire quickly, so make sure to redeem the codes as soon as possible.

Expired Infinity Nikki Codes

Infinity Nikki codes don't last forever and have an expiry time. Here are the expired codes from the game:

How To Redeem Infinity Nikki Codes

To redeem Infinity Nikki codes, open the main menu (Pear-Pal), then locate the Settings button at the bottom of the screen. Next, head to the Other tab, and press Apply on the Redeem Code row. Input the promo code, then press Apply again to redeem the rewards. Unlike Genshin or Honkai: Star Rail codes, the rewards will immediately be added to the player's inventory without needing to check the mailbox.

The most important currency players should look out for would be Diamonds . Every 120 Diamonds can be exchanged for one Revelation or Resonite Crystals; Revelation Crystals are required to pull on the Limited Banner, whereas Resonite Crystals are for the Permanent Banner.
